org.apache.streams.twitter.api

Interface DirectMessages

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Twitter

    @Remoteable(path="https://api.twitter.com/1.1/direct_messages")
public interface DirectMessages
    Interface for /direct_messages methods.
    See Also:
    https://dev.twitter.com/rest/reference

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DirectMessage destroy(Long id)
      Publishes a new message_create event resulting in a Direct Message sent to a specified user from the authenticating user.
      List<DirectMessage> list(DirectMessagesListRequest parameters)
      Returns the 20 most recent direct messages sent to the authenticating user.
      EventsListResponse listEvents(EventsListRequest parameters)
      Returns all Direct Message events (both sent and received) within the last 30 days.
      DirectMessage newDM(DirectMessageNewRequest parameters)
      Destroys the direct message specified in the required ID parameter.
      DirectMessageEvent newEvent(MessageCreateRequest event)
      Destroys the direct message specified in the required ID parameter.
      List<DirectMessage> sent(DirectMessagesSentRequest parameters)
      Returns the 20 most recent direct messages sent to the authenticating user.
      DirectMessage show(Long id)
      The ID of the direct message.
      EventShowResponse showEvent(Long id)
      Returns a single Direct Message event by the given id.

    • Method Detail

      • listEvents

        @RemoteMethod(httpMethod="GET",
              path="/events/list.json")
EventsListResponse listEvents(@QueryIfNE
                                                                                                      EventsListRequest parameters)
        Returns all Direct Message events (both sent and received) within the last 30 days. Sorted in reverse-chronological order.
        Parameters:
        parameters - EventsListRequest
        Returns:
        EventsListResponse
        See Also:
        https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/direct-messages/sending-and-receiving/api-reference/list-events

      • showEvent

        @RemoteMethod(httpMethod="GET",
              path="/events/show.json")
EventShowResponse showEvent(@Query(value="id")
                                                                                                    Long id)
        Returns a single Direct Message event by the given id.
        Returns:
        EventShowResponse
        See Also:
        https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/direct-messages/sending-and-receiving/api-reference/get-event

      • newEvent

        @RemoteMethod(httpMethod="POST",
              path="/events/new.json")
DirectMessageEvent newEvent(@Body
                                                                                                    MessageCreateRequest event)
        Destroys the direct message specified in the required ID parameter. The authenticating user must be the recipient of the specified direct message.
        Parameters:
        event - MessageCreateRequest
        Returns:
        DirectMessageEvent
        See Also:
        https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/direct-messages/sending-and-receiving/api-reference/new-event

      • destroy

        @RemoteMethod(httpMethod="POST",
              path="/destroy.json")
DirectMessage destroy(@Query(value="id")
                                                                                           Long id)
        Publishes a new message_create event resulting in a Direct Message sent to a specified user from the authenticating user. Returns an event in the requested format if successful.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the direct message to delete.
        Returns:
        DirectMessage
        See Also:
        https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/direct-messages/sending-and-receiving/api-reference/new-event

      • show

        @RemoteMethod(httpMethod="GET",
              path="/show.json")
DirectMessage show(@Query(value="id")
                                                                                    Long id)
        The ID of the direct message.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the direct message to delete.
        Returns:
        DirectMessage
        See Also:
        https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/direct-messages/sending-and-receiving/api-reference/new-event

      • list

        @RemoteMethod(httpMethod="GET",
              path=".json")
List<DirectMessage> list(@QueryIfNE
                                                                                     DirectMessagesListRequest parameters)
        Returns the 20 most recent direct messages sent to the authenticating user. Includes detailed information about the sender and recipient user. You can request up to 200 direct messages per call, and only the most recent 200 DMs will be available using this endpoint.
        Parameters:
        parameters - DirectMessagesListRequest
        Returns:
        List[DirectMessage]
        See Also:
        https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/direct-messages/sending-and-receiving/api-reference/get-messages

      • sent

        @RemoteMethod(httpMethod="GET",
              path="/sent.json")
List<DirectMessage> sent(@QueryIfNE
                                                                                          DirectMessagesSentRequest parameters)
        Returns the 20 most recent direct messages sent to the authenticating user. Includes detailed information about the sender and recipient user. You can request up to 200 direct messages per call, and only the most recent 200 DMs will be available using this endpoint.
        Parameters:
        parameters - DirectMessagesSentRequest
        Returns:
        List[DirectMessage]
        See Also:
        https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/direct-messages/sending-and-receiving/api-reference/get-sent-message

      • newDM

        @RemoteMethod(httpMethod="POST",
              path="/new.json")
DirectMessage newDM(@Body
                                                                                     DirectMessageNewRequest parameters)
        Destroys the direct message specified in the required ID parameter. The authenticating user must be the recipient of the specified direct message.
        Parameters:
        parameters - DirectMessageNewRequest
        Returns:
        DirectMessage
        See Also:
        https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/direct-messages/sending-and-receiving/api-reference/new-event
